intro: Onosma setosa, commonly known as the slender onosma, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Onosma setosa is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to dry, coastal climates.
